revised_title: Parent-Offspring Fitness Correlation Under Fluctuating Selection
tldr: The article explores how fluctuating selection forces due to host-parasite cycling can maintain heritable variance in fitness, providing a basis for the evolution of sexual preference. The authors analyze the advantage obtained by a choosing female and show that slow, simultaneous host-parasite cycles can create a permanent source of heritable variance, allowing for mate choice to influence offspring fitness.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
